cases.title: Memory Search Function Broken
cases.description: OpenClaw memory search function is not working properly, cannot retrieve historical memories, identity recognition is damaged
cases.root_cause: Memory index corruption or embedding model mismatch
cases.solution: Refer to openclaw_memory_fix.md for repair steps: 1) Backup existing memory 2) Check memory file integrity 3) Reinitialize memory system if needed

cases.title: Gateway Service Not Starting
cases.description: OpenClaw Gateway service fails to start or crashes immediately after starting
cases.root_cause: Configuration error, port conflict, or missing dependencies
cases.solution: 1) Check configuration file syntax 2) Verify port availability 3) Check logs for specific errors 4) Restart with debug mode

cases.title: API Rate Limit Exceeded
cases.description: API rate limit exceeded error (HTTP 429), cannot make requests to AI model
cases.root_cause: Too many requests in short time, or API quota depleted
cases.solution: 1) Wait for rate limit reset (usually 1 minute) 2) Check API quota status 3) Switch to backup API key if available 4) Contact provider to increase quota

cases.title: Agent Spawn Failed
cases.description: Failed to spawn sub-agent, agent tools not working properly
cases.root_cause: Agent configuration missing or corrupted, agent not registered
cases.solution: 1) Verify agent configuration exists 2) Re-register agents 3) Check agent file permissions 4) Reload agent configurations

cases.title: Channel Configuration Error
cases.description: Channel integration failed, cannot receive or send messages through external platforms
cases.root_cause: Webhook URL incorrect, authentication failed, or channel credentials expired
cases.solution: 1) Verify webhook URL is correct 2) Check authentication tokens 3) Regenerate channel credentials 4) Test with curl command

cases.title: Model Provider Connection Failed
cases.description: Cannot connect to AI model provider, requests timing out or returning errors
cases.root_cause: Network issue, provider service down, or incorrect API endpoint
cases.solution: 1) Check network connectivity 2) Verify API endpoint URL 3) Test with different provider 4) Check provider status page 5) Update API key if expired

cases.title: Configuration File Corrupted
cases.description: Configuration file is corrupted or has syntax errors, preventing OpenClaw from starting
cases.root_cause: Manual edit mistake, incomplete write, or encoding issue
cases.solution: 1) Backup corrupted config 2) Validate JSON syntax 3) Restore from backup if available 4) Regenerate default config 5) Reconfigure settings

cases.title: Multiple Agents Conflict
cases.description: Multiple agents responding to same message, causing confusion or duplicate responses
symptoms: Multiple bots reply to one message
cases.root_cause: Routing rules overlap, agent triggers not specific enough, or channel binding conflict
cases.solution: 1) Review agent routing rules 2) Make triggers more specific 3) Check channel-agent bindings 4) Configure agent priority levels

cases.title: Permission Denied Errors
cases.description: Permission denied when accessing files, directories, or APIs
cases.root_cause: File permissions incorrect, running as wrong user, or API key lacks permissions
cases.solution: 1) Check file ownership and permissions 2) Run with correct user 3) Verify API key permissions 4) Check SELinux/AppArmor if on Linux

cases.title: Log File Too Large
cases.description: Log files growing too large, consuming disk space, slowing down system
cases.root_cause: No log rotation configured, verbose logging enabled, or long-running without cleanup
cases.solution: 1) Enable log rotation 2) Clean old logs 3) Adjust log level 4) Set up automatic cleanup
